brief_summary.textblock:
AMSA nerve block injection is targeted anterior superior alveolar nerve and middle superior
      alveolar nerve branches of infraorbital nerve through nutrient canals. Therefore, central to
      second premolar teeth of one quadrant can be anesthetized. The aim of the present study was
      to evaluate the efficacy of AMSA nerve block injection at an anterior and a posterior
      positions compared to commonly administrated site.

clinical_study.brief_title: Success Rate of Anterior Middle Superior Alveolar (AMSA) Nerve Block in Three Different Sites of Injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Healthy subject

          -  Subjects had all their maxillary teeth from second premolar of one side to the second
             premolar of another Neither of these teeth was non vital, nor had large restorations,
             prosthetic crowns, caries, periodontal disease, history of trauma, and
             hypersensitivity.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Use medications alleviating or altering the pain sensation

          -  Allergy to anesthetics Pregnancy

overall_official.affiliation: Shahid Beheshti University of Medical Sciences

primary_outcome.description: Each teeth were evaluated by electric pulp tester immediately after  injection to 60 minutes every six minutes. Having no reaction to the EPT was the criterion of considering a tooth has been anaesthetized. Anesthesia was considered successful if no reaction to the maximum output for two consecutive tests.
primary_outcome.measure: Pulpal anesthesia of central incisor to second premolar by electric pulp tester (EPT)
primary_outcome.time_frame: After each injection (base line) to 60 minutes

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Outcomes Assessor)
